result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S Abbey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael S Abbey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael S Abbey was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.    Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R Keller.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP:  3 years initial confinement w/credit for 66 days served; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft is eligible for SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.
Letter and attached exhibits to Judge Wagner from Robert Keller dated 10/26/15.

Sentencing hearing at 10-28-2015 03:30 p.m.  Sentencing hearing changed from 10/15/15 at 3:00 to 10/28/15 at 3:30 on the Court's own motion.   Atty Keller notified of the change of date by phone; is to notify his client.

With Atty Keller and Karolyn/Atty Wells the SEH of 9/25/15 at 11am is rescheduled; as Atty Keller needs to address some issues with the PSR and his client has a few matters that need to be given attention before he goes in; reset to 10/15/15 at 3:00pm.

Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R Keller.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 9/25/15 at 11am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Washington.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Washington states that the deft is asking that she withdraw from his case.  Court denies motion to have Atty Washington withdraw.  Atty Washington meets in conference off the record with deft.  Atty Washington returns stating she does not believe she can represent the deft at trial.  Court allows Atty Washinton to withdraw as counsel.  STC 3/13/15 at 9am, deft to appear with his new attorney.  Bond continued.
